caption.p: Single nucleotide polymorphisms within GBA are associated with tissue‐specific patterns of modifier gene expression. Single nucleotide polymorphisms within GBA are physically and functionally associated with the expression levels of 143 modifier genes across the 47 tissues. For example, single nucleotide polymorphisms in GBA form trans‐expression quantitative trail locus connections to AGAP1 (100 Mb away from GBA on chromosome 1) and EPS15 (chromosome 2) in the substantia nigra, both of which have strong neurodevelopmental‐relevant functions. Red, upregulated (normalized effect size is positive); blue, downregulated (normalized effect size is negative). [Color figure can be viewed at wileyonlinelibrary.com]
